buffalo3d.core

Class RendererActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • buffalo3d.core.RendererActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISceneController

    public class RendererActivity
extends Activity
implements ISceneController
    Extend this class when creating your buffalo3d-based Activity. Then, override initScene() and updateScene() for your main 3D logic. Override onCreateSetContentView() to change layout, if desired. To update 3d scene-related variables from within the the main UI thread, override onUpdateScene() and onUpdateScene() as needed.

    • Method Detail

      • setGlesVersion

        public void setGlesVersion(int version)

      • initScene

        public void initScene()
        Instantiation of Object3D's, setting their properties, and adding Object3D's to the scene should be done here. Or any point thereafter. Note that this method is always called after GLCanvas is created, which occurs not only on Activity.onCreate(), but on Activity.onResume() as well. It is the user's responsibility to build the logic to restore state on-resume.
        Specified by:
        initScene in interface ISceneController

      • updateScene

        public void updateScene()
        All manipulation of scene and Object3D instance properties should go here. Gets called on every frame, right before rendering.
        Specified by:
        updateScene in interface ISceneController

      • onInitScene

        public void onInitScene()
        Called _after_ scene init (ie, after initScene). Unlike initScene(), gets called from the UI thread.

      • onUpdateScene

        public void onUpdateScene()
        Called _after_ updateScene() Unlike initScene(), gets called from the UI thread.

      • renderContinuously

        public void renderContinuously(boolean $b)
        Setting this to false stops the render loop, and initScene() and onInitScene() will no longer fire. Setting this to true resumes it.
        Parameters:
        $b - true to resumes the render loop
